title: Rocky Mountain National Park: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Be A Junior Ranger              Be A Junior Ranger          Earn a Badge and Become a Junior Ranger Junior Rangers at Rocky Mountain National Park have fun discovering the natural world, while learning about why we need to protect the special treasures found in our National Parks. We need the help of all our rangers to keep Rocky preserved and protected for many more years to come. Pick up a free Junior Ranger activity booklet at any visitor contact station, discover the park, and become a ranger by earning your badge today! There are 3 different activity book for ages 5 and under, 6-8, and 9 and up.           Junior Ranger Headquarters Located at Hidden Valley.   Junior Ranger Headquarters is a Place Just for Kids! The Junior Ranger Headquarters, located in the summer at Hidden Valley along Trail Ridge Road, is a place just for kids! Join a ranger-led program, complete your Junior Ranger book, and earn a badge all in one place. The Junior Ranger Headquarters is open from June 25 - August 21, in the summer of 2016. The Headquarters is open from 9:45 to 3:15 and programs are offered 4 times a day, 7 days a week, and program times are 10:00 AM, 11:30 AM, 1:00 PM, & 2:30 PM. Programs last 30 minutes and are geared for kids ages 5-13. It is free to participate, and a parent or adult must be present with children at all times.         From programs on Fire to talks about Predators, there are many different program topics offered throughout the summer. NPS Photo       You can also download printable versions of Junior Ranger booklets. For English-language versions:   Junior Ranger Booklet for ages 5 and Under (pdf 3.5M)    Junior Ranger Booklet for ages 6-8 (pdf 2.8M)    Junior Ranger Booklet for ages 9 and Up (pdf 4M)   For Spanish-language versions:  Para edades de 5 años y menores (pdf 3.4M) Para edades 6-8 (pdf 2.9M) Para edades 9 años y mejores (pdf 3.7M)       National Park Service Programs for Kids Become a Junior Ranger on-line through the Web Ranger website. Web Ranger is an extension of the Junior Ranger Program, and is for kids of all ages. If you love our National Parks, Historic Sites and Monuments then this site is just for you!
